intro: Adenocalymma bracteolatum, commonly known as the velvetleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Adenocalymma bracteolatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
